intro: [WRONG START] Pleurotholis zunagensis, commonly known as the Zunagense Orchid, is a species of orchid native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It is a small, epiphytic plant that thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant produces delicate, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink, often with intricate patterns on the petals. Its leaves are typically elongated and arranged in a rosette shape, aiding in water retention. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
